elements.2211.03169_1c33819daefa7218063c5523fecb9: Dexterous and autonomous robots should be capable of executing elaborated dynamical motions skillfully
elements.2211.03169_3f94f5b7f758c238cd01729dbe078: Learning techniques may be leveraged to build models of such dynamic skills
elements.2211.03169_e523b1f2c64b4c71aaa093abde89c: To accomplish this, the learning model needs to encode a stable vector field that resembles the desired motion dynamics
elements.2211.03169_76ef0bd0b2e54c59ba93c636120d0: This is challenging as the robot state does not evolve on a Euclidean space, and therefore the stability guarantees and vector field encoding need to account for the geometry arising from, for example, the orientation representation
elements.2211.03169_362568f4314a7c10af37d7508e71c: To tackle this problem, we propose learning Riemannian stable dynamical systems (RSDS) from demonstrations, allowing us to account for different geometric constraints resulting from the dynamical system state representation
elements.2211.03169_0bc03317aba74c3219a6f14e94b97: Our approach provides Lyapunov-stability guarantees on Riemannian manifolds that are enforced on the desired motion dynamics via diffeomorphisms built on neural manifold ODEs
elements.2211.03169_2b0ad34cbf4c639b22f6a4aaf2a54: We show that our Riemannian approach makes it possible to learn stable dynamical systems displaying complicated vector fields on both illustrative examples and real-world manipulation tasks, where Euclidean approximations fail.
elements.2211.03169_f929af550b856fb660564e6650f36: The promise of having fully-autonomous robots performing a large variety of tasks implies that robots should be able to execute highly-dynamic motions
elements.2211.03169_323a9c189176f018638ebd26379cf: The inherent complexity of these movements makes hand coding an infeasible approach
elements.2211.03169_a891262eccb1bd08c70f74d0bcf76: Therefore learning techniques arise as a potential solution
elements.2211.03169_ced3735298961305bb51740d88a1c: In particular, learning dynamic robot motions from human demonstrations is a promising approach to build models of dynamic skills in an intuitive, sample-efficient and quick manner
elements.2211.03169_3a360b366e98e4405ec8f1a8ee20c: However, learning dynamical motions is not trivial as the learning model requires to provide stability guarantees, which is also an intrinsic property in human motion generation
elements.2211.03169_aedd9e6348bffbab1ae75945b1829: In this context, most research works have focused on learning time-invariant stable dynamical systems for goal-driven motions (a.k.a point-to-point movements) with Lyapunov-stability guarantees

elements.2211.03169_85cd546b2b739b8b882254cbc92fe: We introduced a new approach RSDS to accurately learn vector fields on Riemannian manifolds while ensuring global asymptotic stability, which can not be achieved without taking into account the underlying geometry structure of the data
elements.2211.03169_c4dc6c8a17b65aaeed3da1762bd66: Our model inherits all the advantages of stable dynamical systems, such as high robustness against environmental perturbations
elements.2211.03169_a2d841f46efd9f2b5514de8a1dcdb: To our knowledge, RSDS is the first to leverage neural ODEs on Riemannian manifolds to learn Lyapunov-stable Riemannian dynamical systems
elements.2211.03169_eba81cf8b0b8e74e79211fa1d251c: Moreover, RSDS builds on a new methodology to compute the pullback operator leveraging the characteristics of neural MODEs
elements.2211.03169_2d9ef0a909dbedac5dc9533cac010: Our framework is generic and can theoretically be used to learn vector fields on any Riemannian manifolds with defined exponential and logarithmic maps
elements.2211.03169_ea6a4deab69e3f64fbabb7514d7e1: As future work, we will leverage RSDS to learn vector fields on other Riemannian manifolds such as the manifold of symmetric-positive-definite (SPD) matrices
elements.2211.03169_583fd5eb56e9db190f5c4fe85cf15: , which is relevant in manipulability learning
elements.2211.03169_f8609a659330a190b6b5f6a03f98c: Due to the complexity of the Riemannian operators and the Neural MODE solvers, our framework runs relatively slowly, making it unsuitable for hard real-time applications
elements.2211.03169_c858455070a6a0f705ff1ddc59507: This problem can be alleviated by switching to faster ODE solvers after training, which allows us to accelerate the query time at the expense of precision
elements.2211.03169_871ecab70b3ca6f77c32c558d5c6d: To improve the accuracy and stability of solving Neural MODEs, we can take advantage of techniques such as regularization
elements.2211.03169_557b2252833248b23ddb32f013fbb: and recording checkpoint for the forward mode
elements.2211.03169_848c154af9cb1ce9461da0e51e207: In addition, since we leverage the Lyapunov stability to a single fixed point, the model may still reproduce some trajectories that are inconsistent with the trend of demonstration data due to lack of information for points far from demonstrations
elements.2211.03169_0fbe426d076b51a1c02e004e96e8a: It may be worthwhile exploring other stability criteria, such as contraction analysis
elements.2211.03169_01c4016460cfcaa689df2cff9edfa: , to ensure the incremental exponential stability of trajectories with respect to each other on the manifold.

elements.2211.03169_408f93e180f7a4caabe09a4da0f30: However, for compact manifold such as the

elements.2211.03169_f428bd8b5bd7c6123ae596f8a0f3e: A short discussion on Riemannian approaches for robot motion generation
elements.2211.03169_84720de8aff2cf280f3cc759d46d6: Note that Riemannian geometry has been also leveraged to design robot motion policies that build on the geometry of classical mechanical systems, as proposed in recent works on Riemannian Motion Policies
elements.2211.03169_841c589df208badd0ee2e66988b9d: , and more recently in a generalization called Geometric Fabrics
elements.2211.03169_3755ff0044701974560734958e75b: In this context, RSDS may be seen as learning a control policy represented by a first-order dynamical system, which may be used as a motion policy into the RMPs framework, as RMPs provide a geometric robot motion structure that combines several motion polices with associated Riemannian metrics
elements.2211.03169_7f9b502dcb0bc991acb09172ee9a5: In other words, we may fuse RSDS skills with additional motion policies, like obstacle avoidance behaviors, under the RMPs framework
elements.2211.03169_aaba92948e560caf3c0fc4fa3cb40: Note that RSDS represents a learned first-order dynamic motion policy that does not explicitly consider a specific type of underlying mechanical system
elements.2211.03169_9feaa96b9e84f2cb3bd1097a38fa6: In contrast, RMPs build on Riemannian geometric control to design robot motion policies whose geometry is characterized by, e.g., the associated inertia matrix of the robot dynamics
elements.2211.03169_d705fbb88637cdf1ce9929012572b: It is worth highlighting the difference on the geometric aspects regarding RMPs and RSDS
elements.2211.03169_60122412781f501f2dbd8696ea388: Broadly speaking, the Riemannian structure of RMPs arises from the Riemannian metric associated to the kinetic energy of the robot dynamics
elements.2211.03169_c0780b42474a6e33337675c21748c: , while the Riemannian structure of RSDS comes from the fact that the state variable
elements.2211.03169_be617e15ca6a05235cd6174072483: of the robot in operational space lies on a Riemannian manifold (due to the orientation representation)
elements.2211.03169_d51401bfd09022e617380673d0549: Notice that these two different ways in which Riemannian geometry is leveraged in robotics are complementary to each other
elements.2211.03169_2a2d181568959ec0afbdb6b87f22e: On a related note, Riemannian geometry has been recently leveraged to formulate robot motion generation mechanisms that build on geodesics on learned Riemannian manifolds
elements.2211.03169_3b3277fb6969e3cdca26c8c357d7a: This approach differs from the aforementioned methods as the Riemannian geometry is not intrinsically given by the system dynamics or geometric constraints of the system state
elements.2211.03169_32f779880f99970aff820df3eb811: Instead, the geometric aspect arises from the assumption that trajectories of a robot motion skill define a nonlinear smooth surface that can be interpreted as a data-driven Riemannian manifold.
